title: Workshop on Evaluating Educational Software for Elementary Reading and Writing Instruction

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced courses and extensive practical experience in specialized fields
context.additional_context: Mathematics-integrated curriculum for strengthening administrative/managerial competencies in vocational training institutions. Conducted in a smartphone-centric, limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain five systematic criteria for evaluating the interface, content, and instructional design of elementary reading/writing educational software.
Learners can apply methods to analyze learner adaptability, feedback mechanisms, and progress-tracking features to verify the educational effectiveness of software.
Learners can develop a software evaluation framework applicable in limited technological environments by team and produce a project report with practical case applications.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
